intro: Hieracium oleraceum, commonly known as the common groundsel, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, North Africa, and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that consist of both ray and disc florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with alternate, heart-shaped leaves that are covered in fine hairs. Its yellow flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Hieracium oleraceum is often found in disturbed soils, meadows, and along roadsides, and it can sometimes become invasive in certain regions.
